Randomized response

Randomized response is a technique, introduced in the mid-1960s, to survey people about sensitive topics.  Suppose a teacher decides to survey his students on whether they cheat.  Rather than directly asking each student “Have you cheated?,” a question cheaters are unlikely to answer truthfully, the teacher can employ randomized response.  Rando... Interpreting regression coefficients

Suppose we regress a response on covariates for .  In linear regression, we get the model How do we interpret ?  Does it mean that the th covariate is uncorrelated with the response?
